page.title: 19HOUSING
page.content: {CAMBO.}The houses in Cambo are built from stone and are of a terraced or of a cottage type,and a Pele Tower.Before his death in 1958 Sir Charles Trevelyan had arranged for bathrooms to be added to all the houses,work which was completed by the National Trust when a full water supply and sanitation was provided. {Scots Gap.}The houses are mostly stone.The newer council houses are brick and painted over in grey.Central heating is at present being installed in the council houses. Solid fuel is the most common form of heating.There is no piped gas.Some use bottled gas,others electricity. There are no flats,4 bungalows several detached houses and farmhouses.Most have gardens,not all have garages. Most of the houses had 6 rooms,some had 3 rooms only,the largest 14 rooms.
